visualization_prompt: Generate a gauge chart displaying real-time engine RPM using a radial gradient pivot. The chart should span 240 degrees (-120 to 120), range 0-8000 RPM, and use a dual-tone needle design.
visualization_explanation: The visualization uses a single-dimensional dataset representing instantaneous engine speed measurement. The synthetic RPM value of 6320 follows automotive engineering constraints (μ=6000, σ=1000) simulating normal operation below the 7000-8000 RPM danger zone marked in red. The gauge's 240-degree arc optimizes data-ink ratio by eliminating full-circle redundancy while maintaining proportional scale legibility. Cairo's perceptual principles are implemented through: 1) Color gradient in the danger zone (pre-attentive warning), 2) High-contrast white-on-black labels for readability, and 3) Proportional needle thickness matching real tachometer designs. The dual-tone pivot creates depth perception through radial gradient, enhancing spatial orientation.
